ratings.comment: I had Professor Lindsey for multivariable calc all the way back in Fall 2023 when I was a senior in high school. Going into my first college class, I was extremely nervous, yet Professor Lindsey helped ease my transition in, clearly explaining every concept. 2 midterms and a final worth 28% each, weekly quizzes and homework account for the rest.

I have never had a calculus teacher that explains content as well as Professor Lindsey. She is very aware of what aids student understanding (visualizations) and the things that tend to trip students up. If you attend lecture and do practice test, you will probably be alright.
Fantastic lecturer, nice. Make sure you look at previous exams that she posted.
She was very clear in what she expected of us on exams, and her lectures were recorded- I had 7:45 lecture, but I only went in person a couple times. Great lecturer and very organized

Amazing lecturer. Her lectures matched the material on the exams. The class is extremely exam heavy with 80+% of your grade being from 3 exams, but the professor does post study material. The study guide and the previous exams prepared me well. All homework is online, and for each homework problem you have 20 tries to get it correct.
Very good and energetic and caring professor.

Dr. Lindsey is easily one of the best professors at UW-Madison. She presents complex material in an easy-to-understand manner. Tests are challenging but fair, and expectations are clear. Additionally, she is super accessible and cares for all of her students. If you can take a class with her, do so. She truly is fantastic!

Dr. Lindsey is an amazing lecturer and professor who teaches a great class. Her lectures are informative and easy to understand, and she records them, so you can watch them whenever you need. The class heavily weighs three tests, but she prepares her students well and clearly outlines her expectations for these exams. I highly recommend her class!
Besides the only section being at 7:45 am, this class was very accessible and Melissa is a great teacher. If you keep up with lectures/ watch the recordings the class is not too bad.
Excellent professor who made multivariable calculus about as straightforward as it can be. Office hours are very helpful for clearing up confusing topics.

Dr.Lindsey is the best professor I've ever had. She is an excellent lecturer. In her class, there is always a number of examples for every theorem. Moreover, she always shows us what we need to know and what we don't. 7:45 is kinda early but class is always recorded. I strongly encourage everyone to take her class if you have a chance.
Great professor, very nice and teaches the material very well.
well-organized!

I loved professor Lindsey, she was always available outside of class and really nice about explaining things over again. At times during lecture I felt that she might not have understood what we didn't understand, but that is likely because she is a pro. My main issue is just the class in general, made 0 sense no matter how much effort I put in.

Dr. Lindsey is an awesome professor. I had her for 222 and am now taking 234 with her. Worth the early time slot as all lectures are recorded. She doesn't overcomplicate things and tries her best to make everything understandable. The whole structure of Math 221-234 courses is essentially identical. The tests are weighted heavily so do your best.

Dr. Lindsey is not my official professor (I have Sean Paul for Math 234), but I definitely wish she was. I attended one of her lectures and she was absolutely destined to be a teacher. She is extremely clear and concise in her notes, organized in lecture, and provides plenty of examples. Definitely a gem in a very disorganized math dept. at UW.

Dr. Lindsey gives the clearest lecture I've ever receive at UW-Madison. Scared by lots of comment about calc 2 but she definitely make the content very easy to understand. Assignments can be super hard but if you want to get some in depth knowledge, you'll gain a lot from them. Exams are much easier than assignment.
Goated plz take her

A great professor that explains concepts well with easy-to-follow examples. There are 10 quizzes with 2 quiz drops, and they are pretty easy as long as you complete the homework and the discussion worksheets. But the tests account for 85% of your grade and are much more challenging than Calc 1, so be prepared to put more time into studying.
Calc 2 sucks but Lindsey made me not depressed. She's awesome, just avoid Calc 2 if you can.
Wonderful professor, take her if you can!  She is super clear, organized, and will help you have a great semester.  Very accessible outside of class.

Math 222 will always be hard but Melissa makes it very clear and easier. She is very organized and records all her lectures. 3 exams which are most of your grade and a lot of webassign homework. If you have to take 222, take it with her.

Extreme slow paced lectures that everyone should be able to follow as long as you focus. If you focus in lectures and go to every discussion and practice in the discussions, you should not need to serious do any extra practice (might except do some past exam just to farmiliarize youself).
The tests were a little bit difficult, but about what was expected. Lindsey makes the course content very clear and easy to understand! As long as you stay on top of the homework, it isn't too hard.

Absolutely recommend! Awesome teachers who explains complicated material in a simply and straightforward manner. She uploads every lecture both as a video and as annotated notes. She's the reason I got an A in calc 3.

Prof Lindsey is easily one of the best math professors in the department. She does a great job of verbalizing difficult concepts, and in case you miss lecture she posts the notes and recordings on Canvas so you can watch them back. Feedback outside of class (office hours, Piazza) is extremely helpful as well. Would highly recommend!
If you every have the chance to take her as a professor, do so in a heartbeat. She is the best lecturer and person I've ever met, a rare commodity in the math department of UW.

Lectures were always very organized and easy to follow. She always gave us time to digest the new material with our peers and gave us adequate time to solve the activities. Her attitude was always positive and full of energy. She was always straight forward and did not go into deep detail of the content that did not matter! Great professor!

Professor Lindsey was great, she always uploaded videos of her lectures & annotated notes after class. Even though her lectures were at 7:45 she still had a great energy in class & made math understandable with complex topics. Midterms were 28% of your grade which wasn't great, but there were drops for both quizzes and hw if you missed a day.

Calculus is not an easy topic but Professor Lindsey made concepts easier to understand for first-time students. She is an engaging lecturer, and I was usually able to follow along and understand what was going on, which I can't say the same for with my other math classes. Great professor, I have her for calc 3 next semester and I'm so glad!

She is amazing. Her lectures and slides were very well-organized, and she's great at using simple examples to make the topics easy to understand. I already took AP Calculus BC in high school so that helped, but I'm sure anyone could still do well even without basic calculus knowledge. I'm really looking forward to taking MATH234 with her next term!
the goat of calc 1. She explains everything so clearly and answers questions very well. Very engaging lectures. Best math teacher/professor I've ever had.
Best professor for 221 hands down. Explains everything clearly.
If you have to take math 221 try to get into her class. She is so intelligent and good at explaining all of the concepts in simple ways. I do not like calc at all but I loved Professor Lindsey.

Professor Lindsey is one of the best professors on the math department! Her notes are so organized and neat, and she posts the lectures right after class. She seems to really care for student success and is very enthusiastic about math. Definitely go out of your way to have her!

Lindsey is the best 221 prof you can take. She is a fairly good lecturer and a chiller in that she uploads a recording of the lecture w/ annotated notes immediately after class. There's weekly discussion quizzes & twice-weekly HW. Not a super heavy workload and make sure you take practice exams before the real one for a very attainable A.

Professor Lindsey is an amazing lecturer. Her lectures are always so clear and she posts recordings of them to Canvas in case you have to miss a class. The course itself sucks and is extremely test heavy, so if you get a bad TA it's hard to do well. However, Melissa is extremely helpful during office hours and does what she can to help her students

Professor Lindsey is an amazing lecturer. Very Clear explanation about concept and sample questions and annotated lecture activities are given. However, this course itself is one of the hardest courses I've ever taken. Avoid taking this course without any foundations in Calc!

Lindsey is definitely one of the best profs I've ever had. She is super organized and posts the unannotated slides before class and sends out the annotated slides with the lecture recording right after class. She makes the class very manageable and pretty easy to keep up with.
I think professor lindsey is great! the textbook is online and the homework is online too and due wednesday nights.

Very nice, responds to emails quickly, grades work fairly and gives good feedback, Lots of extra credit opportunities and points to be gained from homework. The only drawback, is that only a select number of questions (usually around 40-50%) are graded on each test, so you can get unlucky with grading.
Good class overall!

Loved professor Lindsey! (Took the class online.) You have to learn a lot of the concepts on your own (mostly from doing homework) as the only instruction comes from short "lecture" videos. She has lots of office hours though and does homework problems during lecture time and always answers all questions. Would have her again.

Prof. Lindsey is a very smart, personable, and kind professor. She wants to see everyone do well. Her lectures are very helpful as she goes through some examples and homework questions. She sometimes will go through explanations fairly quick and writes even faster, but she is easily one of my favorite professors I've had so far.

She is super accommodating, even going as far as removing the face cam on honorlocke during our exams. She is super organized, posting announcements of what the week is going to look like and what is due each week. Her lectures aren't boring as she usually acts excited and upbeat. She is super friendly and approachable. 100% recommend her.
Lectures were asynchronous, but the recordings were always available the next day. The whole next week's schedule with you on Friday. Amazing Professor.

Dr. Lindsey was great! She made it clear what was expected in the class which made it easy to succeed. She showed genuine care for her student as well as always had an exam review the day before the exam which was very helpful. Her lectures were easy to understand and very to the point. Overall a great professor!
She is amazing. Very helpful and one of the best math professor.

Professor Lindsey was one of the best Math teachers I have had in a college math course. Her class is pretty challenging but she is very helpful and does plenty of review sessions to get help. She puts a lot of her time into what she does and wants students to succeed.
